brief_description: Evaluation of influenza vaccination immune response in mice
brief_title: TIV 2008 vaccination of CD95-/- mice and ELISA for detection of influenza-specific antibodies
description: Evaluation of the mouse immune response to influenza vaccination.  ELISA was used to examine the immune response of mutant mice (MRL/Mpj-Faslpr/J (Mpj/lpr), B6.MRL-Faslpr/J (B6/lpr), MRL/MpJ (Mpj) and C57BL/6L (B6)) to a single dose of the trivalent 2008 seasonal influenza vaccine
endpoints: Quantify vaccine-induced influenza-specific antibodies levels via ELISA
hypothesis: Baseline biomarkers from blood can predict the serological response to trivalent, inactivated seasonal influenzavaccine (TIV) in advance of its administration
official_title: Vaccination of CD95-/- mice and ELISA for detection of influenza-specific antibodies

pubmed.title: Apoptosis and other immune biomarkers predict influenza vaccine responsiveness.

program.contract_name: Vaccination and infection: indicators of immunological health and responsiveness
